unsw.cse.mica.tools.timer
Class TimerEvent

java.lang.Object
  unsw.cse.mica.tools.timer.TimerEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class TimerEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

A timer event. Each event consists of the following information:

  • A type. This field is used to specify the MobType when events are converted into Mobs. The type may be null, in which case the default eventType is used when event Mobs are created.
  • A name. This must not be null and must be unique for this event, as events are identified internally by name.
  • A firing time. This is the absolute time (in msecs) that this event will fire. In recurring events this values is updated after each firing to become the new firing time.
  • A period specifying the delay between event firings if the event is recurring.
  • A count of the number of times it the event must still fire. If the event is set to fire indefinitely, This field is set to -1.
  • A map containing additional data to be passed back when the event fires. This information is stored but otherwise ignored by the Timer.

Author:
jhw

TimerEvent

public TimerEvent(java.lang.String type,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  long time,
                  long period)
Create a new recurring event of type type with name name, firing time time and a delay of period ms between firings. The event will keep firing until explicitly stopped.

TimerEvent

public TimerEvent(java.lang.String type,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  long time,
                  long period,
                  int count)
Create a new recurring event of type type with name name, firing time time and a delay of period ms between firings. The event will file count times unless explicitly stopped at an earlier point.
